You're claiming smart contracts solve fix the problem of scams, or needing chargebacks. Scams still happen, even of the sort that could be fixed with a chargeback, with smart contracts in place. Consider that the Steam Marketplace has been allowing people to sell ingame items for small and not so small sums of money to other players just fine for over a decade, even with the ever present threat of chargebacks. If Valve allowed you to cash out wallet balance over a dollar to your bank account it'd function perfectly as a live example of a much simpler and more efficient implementation what NFTs want to be but using "legacy" tech; do note that the technology that would allow Valve to let you cash out your wallet balance exists and has existed for ages, the only reason they haven't implemented it is because they don't want to.

If nothing else I think stuff like Battle Brothers or Kenshi gets a pass, as while you do not command one specific dude there's options to prioritize a particular individual as the "main character", especially in BB where if he dies it's game over.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>618438886
>I want to lick lick lick lick lick lick Monica's knee joint!!
Japs are so based holy shit

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
I played it with no experience from early access or any exposure to it aside from softcore porn posted here.

The game is not very good. The combat focuses on kiting everything at a distance, building up a large magic hit, and deleting it in a few shots. You're pretty agile, but there's not really a point to being so agile outside of a few bosses that utilize your speed to dodge attacks. There aren't very many bosses in the first place.
Graphically, it's kind of like a joke because so many of the environments are samey shit that looks like it was taken straight out of an asset store. It all just looks dull. Enemies are recycled as well and simply recolored. You will be fighting the same motherfuckers from the first couple hours throughout the entire game. The enemy variety is acceptable but not good.
The story is pathetic and there are a load of items you can find that all give you brief insight into the world, and that's fine, but the world is boring as fuck and none of it actually means anything.
The music is a big nothing, no reason to ever listen to it on its own.

The best thing about the game is exploration and doing tricky jumps to find things you aren't supposed to (or sometimes are supposed to), but even that becomes dull when all you really find are consumable items and aforementioned shitty lore items. There are upgrades to magic and inventory space, but they're scarce. The only highlights of the game are a few bosses, and the rest is massively forgettable. Honestly, the game should have been SHORTER for how little it changes from start to finish. It's insane that I could finish this thing in 9 hours and it felt like it should have been 7 hours. Just a huge waste of potential with unrealized combat and setting.

Gen 1 is pretty fun on its own, gen 2 is also pretty good, gen 3 has the best Kanto experience (if you aren't counting unintended glitches) along with Emerald being peak Hoenn, gen 4 has the god-tier Johto remakes with Pokemon Platinum and Gen 5 has both Unova games.

I can't bring myself to recommend gen 7 or Gen 8 outside of USUM being harder than most other mainline games and BDSP's post game Pokemon League being the hardest in the franchise.
If I scraped the bottom of the barrel of the gun you're holding to my head while someone else twisted all my limbs, I'd briefly consider suggesting LGPE and PLA before telling you to pull the fucking trigger.

>>618425202

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>618437832
Depends on context. If it's a joke that can reasonably be communicated without requiring a paragraph of translator's notes (which would kill the joke), or something that might require a smidgeon of relevant knowledge that can be expected from the person playing the game (eg; a Jojo reference), then it should be conveyed accurately. If it's something that couldn't reasonably be interpreted by the target audience (eg a reference to the chorus of some '70s Japanese pop song, or an obscure kanji pun) then it should be replaced with something that conveys the joke as closely as possible, like a reference to an international pop song, or English wordplay. Changing anything further than that is cringe, outside of very exceptional cases (Ace Attorney's localisation springs to mind as a great example of something that is wholly inaccurate yet not inferior).
